intro: Dalechampia anomala, commonly known as the golden cup or velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, often colorful inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped with a rough texture, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Dalechampia anomala is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique flowering structures.
